OOC: I'm the only one who didn't see Invasion, I guess.

BIC: Burning Hamme=
r still lies unconscious...

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: rAuq 
=
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Sunday, July 22, 2001 11:56 PM
  Subj=
ect: Lynxiz - Lokk - Axis


  OOC: Invasion was cool, Jer and I just watche=
d it on ppv. =3D)

  --- Lynxiz / Axis / Lokk ---

  Lynxiz enters the Chiv=
itron base, and heads for the CR chambers. 
  Trinity was looking pale, but=
 would likely survive the ordeal. As she 
  enters the CR room, she spots B=
urning Hammer on the ground 
  unconcious, "Burning Hammer? Uhh, hello?" Sh=
e puts Trinity into 
  an empty (obviously =3DP) CR chamber, and starts the=
 process 
  knowing that the small bot will be done soon. Then she turns to=
 
  BH, "Hmmm, you don't look so good..." She kneels beside him, 
  and exa=
mines him, looking for a reason for his unconcious state.

  Meanwhile, out=
side the Chivitron base, Lokk is still hiding behind 
  the hill. He spots =
Windlord fighting close combat with Vampiza, 
  and grumbles, not wanting t=
o shoot and damage his fellow 
  Chivitron. He picks out Apewing, and his t=
win chainguns unload 
  half a clip each, hoping to surprise the bot.

  Ax=
is peeks his head over the pod, and spots Speed Viper. He fires 
  a laser =
blast, then arcs a missile at the bot. Then he crouches 
  back behind the =
pod.


  On 22 Jul 2001, at 18:02, Roland the Last Gunslinger wrote:

  > O=
OC: Mmmmmm YOU KNOW WHAT? ME TOO! WCW AND ECW! YES! WWF? BOO! WILLIAM
  > R=
EGAL AND TAJIRI HAD BETTER LEAVE WWF FAST BECAUSE THEIR SHIP IS
  > SINKING=
! LONG LIVE THE ERA OF WCWECW!!! If you Wiiil, pardon me for
  > making tha=
t strange OOC message, I won't kill you. I'm sadly not
  > seeing Invasion,=
 by the way.  : \  Oh, and we're not really such huge
  > marks, we're just=
 trying to have a little fun...
  > 
  > BIC (ick): Burning Hammer puts Per=
plex in a CR Chamber, turns around,
  > and suddenly falls on the floor wit=
h a thud and goes unconscious for
  > seemingly no reason at all...
